title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 1 Kings chapter 10 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 1 Kings Chapter 10.

questions.question: Who came to test Solomon with hard questions?
questions.correctAnswer: The queen of Sheba
questions.explanation: 1 Kings 10:1 says the queen of Sheba heard of Solomon's fame and came to prove him with hard questions.

questions.question: What did the queen of Sheba bring with her to Jerusalem?
questions.correctAnswer: Spices, gold, and precious stones
questions.explanation: 1 Kings 10:2 describes that she came with camels bearing spices, much gold, and precious stones.

questions.question: How did Solomon respond to the queen of Sheba's questions?
options: He told her all her questions with nothing hidden
He asked his advisors to answer
questions.correctAnswer: He told her all her questions with nothing hidden
questions.explanation: According to 1 Kings 10:3, Solomon answered all her questions; nothing was hidden from him.

questions.question: What impressed the queen of Sheba about Solomon?
options: His wisdom and the house he built
questions.correctAnswer: His wisdom and the house he built
questions.explanation: 1 Kings 10:4 states she saw Solomon's wisdom and the house he had built.

questions.question: What did the queen of Sheba say about the report she heard about Solomon before visiting?
options: The half was not told her
questions.correctAnswer: The half was not told her
questions.explanation: In 1 Kings 10:7, she said the half was not told her of Solomon’s wisdom and prosperity.

questions.question: According to 1 Kings 10, who is blessed because the LORD loved Israel forever?
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon
questions.explanation: 1 Kings 10:9 says Solomon was blessed because the LORD loved Israel and set him on the throne to do justice.

questions.question: How much gold did the queen of Sheba give to Solomon?
questions.correctAnswer: 120 talents
questions.explanation: 1 Kings 10:10 states she gave Solomon 120 talents of gold along with spices and precious stones.

questions.question: What special wood did the navy of Hiram bring from Ophir?
questions.correctAnswer: Almug trees
questions.explanation: 1 Kings 10:11 describes the navy of Hiram bringing almug trees from Ophir.

questions.question: What did Solomon make from the almug trees?
options: Pillars for the house of the LORD and musical instruments
questions.correctAnswer: Pillars for the house of the LORD and musical instruments
questions.explanation: 1 Kings 10:12 says Solomon made pillars and harps and psalteries from almug trees.

questions.question: True or False: Solomon made his throne entirely of gold without any other materials.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 Kings 10:18 explains the throne was made of ivory and overlaid with the best gold, not entirely gold.

questions.question: True or False: Solomon’s drinking vessels were made of silver.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 Kings 10:21 states all drinking vessels were made of gold, and none were of silver.

questions.question: True or False: The navy of Tharshish came every year bringing valuable goods to Solomon.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 Kings 10:22 says the navy of Tharshish came once every three years.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'And Solomon gathered together chariots and horsemen: and he had _______ chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen.'
questions.correctAnswer: a thousand and four hundred
questions.explanation: 1 Kings 10:26 states Solomon had 1,400 chariots and 12,000 horsemen.

questions.question: How many shields of beaten gold did Solomon make?
questions.correctAnswer: Three hundred
questions.explanation: 1 Kings 10:17 says Solomon made 300 shields of beaten gold.

questions.question: What kind of animals were brought by the navy of Tharshish to Solomon?
questions.correctAnswer: Apes and peacocks
questions.explanation: 1 Kings 10:22 lists the navy bringing gold, silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks.

medium.title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 1 Kings Chapter 10 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does the visit of the queen of Sheba in 1 Kings 10 teach us about the value of seeking wisdom and understanding?
options: It shows that testing and asking questions can lead to greater knowledge and respect.
It suggests that wealth is the most important measure of success.
It indicates that only kings should possess wisdom.
It implies that questions should be avoided to maintain peace.
questions.correctAnswer: It shows that testing and asking questions can lead to greater knowledge and respect.
questions.explanation: The queen of Sheba came to Solomon to prove him with hard questions, and Solomon answered all of them, demonstrating the importance of seeking wisdom and understanding (1 Kings 10:1-3). This teaches us to value inquiry and learning as a pathway to growth.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with doubt about God's blessings in their life. Based on 1 Kings 10, what biblical truth would you share regarding faith and trust?
options: Seeing God's blessings firsthand can strengthen faith beyond what we hear from others.
Doubting is a sign that God has forgotten us.
Material wealth is the only proof of God's favor.
Faith does not require any evidence or experience.
questions.correctAnswer: Seeing God's blessings firsthand can strengthen faith beyond what we hear from others.
questions.explanation: The queen of Sheba initially did not believe the reports about Solomon’s wisdom and prosperity until she saw it herself, which strengthened her faith (1 Kings 10:6-7). This passage encourages believers to trust God’s faithfulness and seek personal experience with His blessings.

questions.question: What does Solomon’s response to the queen of Sheba’s questions teach about integrity and honesty in leadership?
options: A leader should respond fully and truthfully to questions without hiding anything.
A leader should only share information that flatters others.
Leaders should avoid difficult questions to maintain power.
It is better for leaders to keep secrets to control their subjects.
questions.correctAnswer: A leader should respond fully and truthfully to questions without hiding anything.
questions.explanation: Solomon told the queen all her questions; nothing was hidden from him (1 Kings 10:3). This highlights the importance of honesty and transparency in leadership for building trust and respect.

questions.question: How does the lavishness of Solomon’s throne and house challenge believers about contentment and gratitude?
options: It encourages believers to be grateful for God’s blessings while avoiding greed.
It teaches that extravagance is the only sign of God’s favor.
Believers should seek to amass wealth to display their status.
Contentment is not important when God gives abundance.
questions.correctAnswer: It encourages believers to be grateful for God’s blessings while avoiding greed.
questions.explanation: Solomon’s great throne and house (1 Kings 10:18-20) illustrate God’s blessing on him, but believers are reminded to practice gratitude and avoid greed despite such abundance (1 Kings 10:23).

questions.question: A believer wants to serve others in the church with a heart of generosity. What does 1 Kings 10 show about stewardship and generosity?
options: Generosity is a way to bless others and honor God with what He has given.
Wealth should be kept only for personal use.
Only kings are responsible for generosity.
Generosity is optional and unrelated to faith.
questions.correctAnswer: Generosity is a way to bless others and honor God with what He has given.
questions.explanation: Solomon gave generously to the queen of Sheba and others, showing that using wealth to bless others honors God (1 Kings 10:10, 13, 25). This models stewardship and generosity for believers.

questions.question: True or False: The queen of Sheba’s visit to Solomon shows that humility is unnecessary when one is greatly blessed.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The queen of Sheba acknowledged Solomon’s wisdom was greater than she had heard and blessed the LORD for setting him over Israel (1 Kings 10:6-9), showing humility and recognition of God’s work rather than pride.

questions.question: How does Solomon’s large army and chariot force relate to the biblical principle of faithful stewardship?
options: It shows that using resources wisely to protect and provide for the community is part of stewardship.
It teaches that military power is the only way to gain respect.
Believers should focus solely on spiritual matters, ignoring physical needs.
Stewardship means avoiding all forms of responsibility.
questions.correctAnswer: It shows that using resources wisely to protect and provide for the community is part of stewardship.
questions.explanation: Solomon gathered chariots and horsemen and stationed them to serve the kingdom responsibly (1 Kings 10:26). This demonstrates stewardship includes managing resources for protection and provision.

questions.question: Which lesson about prayer and devotion can be drawn from Solomon’s ascent to the house of the LORD as noted in 1 Kings 10?
options: Approaching God’s house with reverence and worship reflects a heart devoted to God.
Prayer is unnecessary when one has wisdom.
Material wealth guarantees spiritual favor without devotion.
Devotion is only required for kings and leaders.
questions.correctAnswer: Approaching God’s house with reverence and worship reflects a heart devoted to God.
questions.explanation: The queen of Sheba was amazed at Solomon’s ascent to the house of the LORD, indicating the importance of reverence and worship in spiritual life (1 Kings 10:5). This encourages believers to cultivate devotion through prayer and worship.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Kings 10, the fame of Solomon's wisdom caused many nations to seek him, illustrating the impact of godly wisdom in evangelism.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: All the earth sought Solomon to hear his wisdom, showing how godly wisdom can attract others and serve as a witness (1 Kings 10:23-24).

questions.question: What does the queen of Sheba’s recognition of Solomon’s wisdom and prosperity teach about humility in the face of God’s blessings?
options: Acknowledging God’s hand in blessings leads to humility and praise.
Pride is justified when receiving great blessings.
Blessings mean a person is better than others.
It is best to keep blessings secret to avoid jealousy.
questions.correctAnswer: Acknowledging God’s hand in blessings leads to humility and praise.
questions.explanation: The queen blessed the LORD and recognized He set Solomon on the throne because He loved Israel (1 Kings 10:8-9), showing humility and praise towards God for blessings.

questions.question: A believer faces the temptation to rely on their own wisdom rather than God’s guidance. What principle from 1 Kings 10 can you share to encourage humility and dependence on God?
options: Solomon’s wisdom was a gift from God, showing the need to depend on Him for understanding.
Wisdom comes only from personal effort without God’s help.
One should never ask for wisdom from God.
Human wisdom is superior to God’s plans.
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon’s wisdom was a gift from God, showing the need to depend on Him for understanding.
questions.explanation: The chapter highlights that Solomon’s wisdom was given by God, encouraging believers to seek God’s guidance rather than rely solely on themselves (1 Kings 10:23-24).

questions.question: How does the abundance of gold and precious materials in Solomon’s kingdom challenge believers about contentment and gratitude?
options: It reminds believers to be content with what God provides and be grateful rather than greedy.
It teaches that wealth is the ultimate goal of faith.
Believers should always seek to increase their riches by any means.
Contentment is unimportant when wealth increases.
questions.correctAnswer: It reminds believers to be content with what God provides and be grateful rather than greedy.
questions.explanation: Solomon’s great wealth (1 Kings 10:14-22) shows God’s provision but also calls believers to practice contentment and gratitude rather than greed.

questions.question: What does Solomon’s acceptance of gifts from other kings and merchants teach about honesty and integrity in business and relationships?
options: Maintaining honest and respectful relationships leads to mutual blessings and peace.
Receiving gifts is always a sign of corruption.
Integrity is unnecessary in trade and diplomacy.
One should avoid all interaction with others to maintain purity.
questions.correctAnswer: Maintaining honest and respectful relationships leads to mutual blessings and peace.
questions.explanation: Solomon received gifts annually from kings and merchants (1 Kings 10:25), reflecting honest diplomacy and trade relationships based on integrity.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Solomon made two hundred targets of _____ gold, with six hundred shekels per target.
questions.correctAnswer: beaten
questions.explanation: 1 Kings 10:16 states that Solomon made two hundred targets of beaten gold, with six hundred shekels of gold going to one target.

questions.question: How does the queen of Sheba’s respectful approach and praise of Solomon teach believers about humility and witnessing?
options: Respectful inquiry and acknowledging God’s work in others can open hearts to faith.
One should never question others’ wisdom or gifts.
Humility is irrelevant in sharing faith.
questions.correctAnswer: Respectful inquiry and acknowledging God’s work in others can open hearts to faith.
questions.explanation: The queen came with respect, asked questions, and praised God for Solomon’s wisdom (1 Kings 10:1, 6-9), modeling humility and openness essential for sharing faith.

questions.question: What practical lesson about perseverance through trials can be learned from the queen of Sheba’s journey to test Solomon’s wisdom?
options: Seeking truth and understanding may require effort and persistence, leading to spiritual growth.
Faith should be immediate without questioning.
Trials mean God is displeased and should be avoided.
Doubt should stop believers from seeking God.
questions.correctAnswer: Seeking truth and understanding may require effort and persistence, leading to spiritual growth.
questions.explanation: The queen traveled a long distance to test Solomon’s wisdom (1 Kings 10:1-2), demonstrating perseverance in seeking truth which resulted in increased faith and praise to God.

hard.title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 1 Kings Chapter 10.

questions.question: What was the primary reason the queen of Sheba visited Solomon, according to 1 Kings 10?
options: To prove Solomon with hard questions
To make an alliance with Israel
To seek a marriage alliance with Solomon
questions.correctAnswer: To prove Solomon with hard questions
questions.explanation: The queen of Sheba came to Solomon to test him with difficult questions, as stated in 1 Kings 10:1.

questions.question: Which items did the queen of Sheba bring with her to Jerusalem to present to Solomon?
questions.correctAnswer: Spices, gold, and precious stones
questions.explanation: According to 1 Kings 10:2, the queen came with camels bearing spices, much gold, and precious stones.

questions.question: How did Solomon respond to the queen of Sheba's questions?
options: He told her all her questions without hiding anything
He answered only some of her questions
He asked for more gifts before answering
He deferred the answers to his officials
questions.correctAnswer: He told her all her questions without hiding anything
questions.explanation: 1 Kings 10:3 states Solomon told the queen all her questions and hid nothing from her.

questions.question: What aspects of Solomon’s kingdom impressed the queen of Sheba so much that she lost her spirit?
options: His wisdom, his house, the food at his table, and the apparel of his servants
The size of his army and the number of his chariots
The number of his wives and concubines
questions.correctAnswer: His wisdom, his house, the food at his table, and the apparel of his servants
questions.explanation: 1 Kings 10:4-5 describe how the queen was overwhelmed by Solomon’s wisdom, his house, his table’s food, and the apparel and attendance of his servants.

questions.question: Which phrase in 1 Kings 10:9 reveals the theological reason for Solomon's kingship?
options: "The LORD loved Israel for ever, therefore made he thee king"
"Thy wisdom and prosperity exceedeth the fame"
"There was not any thing hid from the king"
questions.correctAnswer: "The LORD loved Israel for ever, therefore made he thee king"
questions.explanation: Verse 9 highlights that Solomon’s kingship is rooted in God’s eternal love for Israel and His delight in Solomon.

questions.question: How much gold did the queen of Sheba give to Solomon?
questions.correctAnswer: One hundred and twenty talents
questions.explanation: 1 Kings 10:10 records the queen gave Solomon one hundred and twenty talents of gold.

questions.question: What unique materials did the navy of Hiram bring from Ophir, as mentioned in 1 Kings 10?
questions.correctAnswer: Almug trees and precious stones
questions.explanation: Verse 11 specifies the navy of Hiram brought almug trees and precious stones from Ophir.

questions.question: For what purposes did Solomon use almug wood according to 1 Kings 10:12?
options: Pillars for the house of the LORD, pillars for the king’s house, and musical instruments
questions.correctAnswer: Pillars for the house of the LORD, pillars for the king’s house, and musical instruments
questions.explanation: 1 Kings 10:12 describes Solomon used almug trees for pillars in the temple and palace, as well as harps and psalteries.

questions.question: True or False: Solomon made 300 shields of beaten gold, each weighing three pounds of gold.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 Kings 10:17 confirms Solomon made 300 shields of beaten gold, each weighing three pounds.

questions.question: Describe the design features of Solomon’s great throne as found in 1 Kings 10.
options: Six steps, a round top, stays on either side, and twelve lions on the steps
Four pillars, a square seat, and engravings of cherubim
Three steps with gold overlay and a lion carved on the back
Eight steps, a high back, and silver inlays
questions.correctAnswer: Six steps, a round top, stays on either side, and twelve lions on the steps
questions.explanation: Verses 19-20 describe the throne with six steps, a round top, stays on either side, and twelve lions on the steps.

questions.question: Which of the following best explains the significance of Solomon’s drinking vessels and vessels in the house of the forest of Lebanon?
options: They were all made of gold, and silver was considered insignificant
They were crafted from silver and ivory as symbols of wealth
They were made of bronze to symbolize strength
They were made of clay as a sign of humility
questions.correctAnswer: They were all made of gold, and silver was considered insignificant
questions.explanation: 1 Kings 10:21 explains that all drinking vessels were gold, and silver was not accounted of in Solomon’s days.

questions.question: How often did the navy of Tharshish come to Solomon, and what did they bring, according to 1 Kings 10?
options: Once every three years bringing gold, silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks
Every year bringing spices, horses, and gold
Once every five years bringing linen and horses
Twice a year bringing chariots and slaves
questions.correctAnswer: Once every three years bringing gold, silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks
questions.explanation: Verse 22 states the navy of Tharshish came once every three years bringing those items.

questions.question: How does 1 Kings 10:23 describe Solomon’s status compared to other kings of the earth?
options: He exceeded all kings for riches and wisdom
He was known only for his wealth, not wisdom
He was feared for his military power
He was considered weak by other kings
questions.correctAnswer: He exceeded all kings for riches and wisdom
questions.explanation: 1 Kings 10:23 states Solomon surpassed all kings in riches and wisdom.

questions.question: What kind of military forces did Solomon gather, according to 1 Kings 10:26?
questions.correctAnswer: 1,400 chariots and 12,000 horsemen
questions.explanation: Verse 26 states Solomon had 1,400 chariots and 12,000 horsemen stationed in cities and near him.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Solomon made silver to be in Jerusalem as ______, and cedars as the ______.
questions.correctAnswer: stones; sycomore trees
questions.explanation: 1 Kings 10:27 uses a simile to show the abundance of silver and cedar by comparing silver to stones and cedars to sycomore trees.

questions.question: What was the price of a chariot and a horse brought from Egypt according to 1 Kings 10?
options: Six hundred shekels of silver for a chariot, and one hundred and fifty for a horse
One thousand shekels of silver for each chariot and horse
Five hundred shekels for a chariot, two hundred for a horse
Seven hundred shekels for a chariot, one hundred for a horse
questions.correctAnswer: Six hundred shekels of silver for a chariot, and one hundred and fifty for a horse
questions.explanation: Verse 29 details the price as six hundred shekels of silver for a chariot and one hundred fifty for a horse from Egypt.

theological.title: 1 Kings Chapter 10 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 1 Kings Chapter 10 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What was the primary reason the queen of Sheba visited King Solomon according to 1 Kings 10?
options: To test Solomon with hard questions
To learn the art of war
questions.correctAnswer: To test Solomon with hard questions
questions.explanation: The queen of Sheba came to prove Solomon with hard questions, demonstrating a test of wisdom (1 Kings 10:1). This aligns with Proverbs 2:6, James 1:5, and Colossians 2:3, where wisdom is revealed by God and sought after by believers.

questions.question: What items did the queen of Sheba bring with her when she visited Solomon?
questions.correctAnswer: Spices, gold, and precious stones
questions.explanation: The queen came with camels bearing spices, very much gold, and precious stones (1 Kings 10:2). This reflects the wealth and honor she accorded Solomon, consistent with the biblical motif of honoring God's anointed (Psalm 72:10-15, Isaiah 60:6).

questions.question: How did Solomon respond to the queen of Sheba's questions?
options: He told her all, nothing was hidden from him
He answered only half of the questions
He asked her questions in return
questions.correctAnswer: He told her all, nothing was hidden from him
questions.explanation: Solomon answered all the queen’s questions without hiding anything (1 Kings 10:3). This illustrates God’s gift of wisdom to Solomon (1 Kings 3:12), fulfilling the divine promise to grant understanding (James 1:5).

questions.question: What was the queen of Sheba's reaction upon seeing Solomon's wisdom and royal splendor?
options: She was overwhelmed and had no spirit left
questions.correctAnswer: She was overwhelmed and had no spirit left
questions.explanation: The queen was so impressed that there was no more spirit in her (1 Kings 10:5), indicating awe at divine wisdom. This parallels biblical themes of reverence and fear of God’s wisdom (Ecclesiastes 12:13, Isaiah 11:2-3).

questions.question: According to 1 Kings 10, what reason did the queen of Sheba give for Solomon’s success and wisdom?
options: The LORD loved Israel and set Solomon on the throne
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD loved Israel and set Solomon on the throne
questions.explanation: She recognized that the LORD loved Israel and placed Solomon as king to do judgment and justice (1 Kings 10:9), reflecting God’s sovereign rule and covenant faithfulness (Psalm 89:20-29, Isaiah 9:6-7).

questions.question: How much gold did the queen of Sheba give to King Solomon?
questions.correctAnswer: One hundred and twenty talents
questions.explanation: She gave Solomon 120 talents of gold, a very large amount (1 Kings 10:10). This symbolizes the recognition of God’s blessing on Solomon, consistent with the biblical principle that God richly provides for His anointed (Deuteronomy 8:18, 2 Corinthians 9:8).

questions.question: What was unique about the almug trees brought from Ophir as described in 1 Kings 10?
options: They were used to make pillars, harps, and psalteries, and were very rare
They were used as fuel for the temple altar
They were planted around the city walls
questions.correctAnswer: They were used to make pillars, harps, and psalteries, and were very rare
questions.explanation: The almug trees were used for pillars and musical instruments, and no such trees were seen afterward (1 Kings 10:11-12). This emphasizes God's provision for worship and order, aligning with biblical themes of sacred music and temple construction (Psalm 150, Exodus 25:1-9).

questions.question: What does Solomon’s great throne symbolize in biblical theology?
questions.correctAnswer: God’s sovereign rule and justice
questions.explanation: The throne, made of ivory and overlaid with gold with lions symbolizing strength and justice (1 Kings 10:18-20), symbolizes God's sovereign kingship and righteous judgment, a theme fulfilled ultimately in Christ as King (Revelation 19:16, Psalm 45:6-7).

questions.question: How does 1 Kings 10 describe the abundance of Solomon’s wealth and wisdom compared to other kings?
options: Solomon exceeded all the kings of the earth
He was equal to other kings
He was less wealthy and wise
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon exceeded all the kings of the earth
questions.explanation: Solomon’s riches and wisdom surpassed all kings (1 Kings 10:23), illustrating God's blessing on obedience and His providential rule (Psalm 112:3, Daniel 2:20-22). This foreshadows Christ as the ultimate source of wisdom and riches (Colossians 2:3).

questions.question: What did all the earth seek from Solomon according to the chapter?
questions.correctAnswer: To hear his wisdom
questions.explanation: All the earth sought Solomon to hear his wisdom (1 Kings 10:24), reflecting the desire for divine wisdom and understanding, a biblical theme from Proverbs 8:1-21 to James 3:13-18.

questions.question: What kind of military force did Solomon maintain according to the chapter?
questions.correctAnswer: 1400 chariots and 12,000 horsemen
questions.explanation: Solomon gathered 1400 chariots and 12,000 horsemen (1 Kings 10:26), showing his temporal authority and power. This military strength complements his wisdom, but biblical wisdom emphasizes reliance on God rather than military might (Psalm 20:7, Proverbs 21:31).

questions.question: What does the chapter reveal about the divine blessing on Solomon's reign?
options: God gave Solomon wisdom and great riches
questions.correctAnswer: God gave Solomon wisdom and great riches
questions.explanation: Solomon’s wisdom and riches are attributed to God’s blessing (1 Kings 10:23-24), showing God's providential care and fulfillment of His promises (Deuteronomy 7:13-14, James 1:5).

questions.question: How often did the navy of Tharshish come to Solomon, and what did it bring?
options: Once every three years, bringing gold, silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks
questions.correctAnswer: Once every three years, bringing gold, silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks
questions.explanation: The navy of Tharshish came every three years with luxury items (1 Kings 10:22), indicating international trade under divine provision, consistent with Old Testament trade networks and New Testament references to wealth and wisdom (Ecclesiastes 2:8, Revelation 18:11-13).

questions.question: How did Solomon’s reign demonstrate the attribute of God’s providence?
options: Through the abundant wealth, wisdom, and peace granted to him
questions.correctAnswer: Through the abundant wealth, wisdom, and peace granted to him
questions.explanation: Solomon’s reign shows God’s providence by granting wisdom and riches (1 Kings 10:23-27), echoing biblical teaching on God’s care for His people (Psalm 104:27-28, Matthew 6:26).

questions.question: What does the queen of Sheba’s visit reveal about the global recognition of God’s wisdom in Solomon?
options: God’s wisdom given to Solomon was renowned even to distant lands
The queen came to spy on Solomon
questions.correctAnswer: God’s wisdom given to Solomon was renowned even to distant lands
questions.explanation: The queen of Sheba, from a distant land, came to test Solomon’s wisdom (1 Kings 10:1-2), demonstrating how God’s wisdom extended influence beyond Israel, consistent with biblical themes of God’s sovereignty over all nations (Psalm 72:8, Isaiah 45:22).

questions.question: How does 1 Kings 10 demonstrate the fulfillment of God's covenant promises to David?
options: Solomon’s throne, wisdom, and prosperity fulfill God’s promises to David
Solomon failed to maintain David’s kingdom
The chapter does not mention David’s covenant
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon’s throne, wisdom, and prosperity fulfill God’s promises to David
questions.explanation: Solomon’s reign with wisdom and a glorious throne reflects God’s covenant to David about his offspring’s kingdom (1 Kings 10:9, 1 Chronicles 17:11-14, Psalm 89:3-4, 2 Samuel 7:12-16), pointing typologically to Christ, the eternal King.
